thread.title: Six top things to do in Sydney this long weekend | DailyTelegraph
thread.title_full: Six top things to do in Sydney this long weekend | DailyTelegraph

author: dailytelegraph.com
title: Six top things to do in Sydney this long weekend | DailyTelegraph
text:
It’s a long weekend and the weather promises to be fantastic. Of course you could stay home and watch the AFL and NRL grand finals, but here are six more top ways to enjoy the break.
1: GAMING EXPO
EB Expo, Sydney Showground, 1 Showground Rd, Sydney Olympic Park; Saturday and Sunday, $39.95-$199, ebgames.com.au
Calling all gamers: At this popular expo, you can get a sneak peek at highly anticipated, unreleased games such as Star Wars, Battlefront, Call Of Duty: Black Ops III, Assassin’s Creed: Syndicate, and Halo 5: Guardians. If that’s not enough, there will also be plenty of entertainment, including fireworks, comedy duo The Umbilical Brothers and free light-sabre combat lessons from specialists in the art, Sons Of Obiwan. Tomorrow promises loads of fun for families, too, as they can try out Just Dance 2016 and Nintendo’s Yo-Kai Watch, to name just a couple.
Shuang West and Diana Bui check out a sculpture on the new Goods Line walk in Ultimo. 2: OPEN DAY AND WALK
#The Goods, Sydney Architecture Festival, The Goods Line, Thomas St, Ultimo; Saturday, 8am-9pm, free, sydneyarchitecturefestival.org
Other Stories Daylight savings starts Sunday Nsw Boyd: The father I wish I’d had Nrl What’s the Buzz: Saint, Sinner, Shoosh Nrl 0 comments Bieber Island an expensive flop for Seven Sydney Confidential 0 comments Shocked mum slams ‘Toey Joey’ National Rowe’s crap housewife skills put to test Sydney Confidential 0 comments Check out the amazing transformation of an old goods railway line into an inviting and interactive walking and cycling in the heart of the city at it’s first big festival. There will be yoga and tai chi sessions, drawing and photography classes, talks with young architects, films, a zine fair, book swap, history tours and kids activities.
Manly will be awash with the cool sounds of jazz this long weekend. Picture: Troy Snook
